item.title: Revenge of the Queen Codes (January 2026)
item.description:
Step into the fancy palace world of Revenge of the Queen , where you play as a smart queen reborn in ancient times, making friends, solving puzzles, and climbing to power while getting your big comeback. Dress up in beautiful outfits, cook yummy food, and build relationships to outsmart rivals and change your story. Unlock cozy rooms like bedrooms or grand halls, fish for fun, and visit friends' homes for parties. It's like a royal adventure with choices that twist everything, perfect for players who love stories and fashion.

Working codes are great because they give free gold and items right away, helping you get pretty clothes or helpful tools faster without waiting, so you enjoy the palace fun quicker.

All Revenge of the Queen Codes

Working Revenge of the Queen Codes

  • Followus2357 – Gold & Common Writ

Expired Revenge of the Queen Codes

None yet!

Codes and the rewards they give are super important in Revenge of the Queen , because they hand out free gold or special items that let you unlock fancy outfits, helpful tools, or palace upgrades right from the beginning, skipping those early moments where you might feel stuck waiting for small rewards from daily tasks or puzzles that take time to build up. They can help you rebirth into a palace star much quicker, so you focus on fun choices like making allies or plotting clever comebacks without the drag of slow grinding.

This helps beginners avoid the frustration of basic starts where rivals seem too strong, allowing everyone to experiment with different paths. Plus, extra gold opens up opportunities for collaborative play with friends.

How to Redeem Revenge of the Queen Codes

  • Open Revenge of the Queen and start playing.
  • Finish a quick tutorial.
  • Tap the player icon button in the top-left corner.
  • Go to Settings and then to Exchange.
  • Type a working code into the text box.
  • Hit the Confirm button to claim your rewards.

How to Get More Revenge of the Queen Codes

  • Join the official Discord
  • Check the game's Facebook group

Your prime hub for collecting all the free codes for this awesome game is this guide. As soon as codes are released, they are added to this page, so you receive all the free rewards as soon as possible.

Revenge of the Queen is available on mobile devices.

item.title: The 10 Greatest Open-World Action-Adventure Games Of All Time, Ranked
item.description:
Open-world and action-adventure go hand-in-hand, and when you combine the two, you get some of the greatest games of all time. Titles that offer boundless freedom, scintillating combat, memorable characters, beautiful visuals, and gripping stories, all set in an expansive sandbox that is just beginning to be discovered. These projects cover fantasy epics, sci-fi masterpieces, and grounded tales of humanity.

The best open-world action-adventure games are, somehow, both relatively modern and timeless. While beloved at launch, they continue to drag players back into their realms, keeping them there for years on end. This is a nearly impossible task, but let’s highlight the action-adventure open-world games that are basically flawless.

The article will only include action-adventure games, excluding open-world RPGs. The genres tend to overlap, but we want to focus solely on the former.

These games or franchises will not be included since they are action RPGS:

  • Cyberpunk 2077
  • Elden Ring
  • Fable
  • Fallout
  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Genshin Impact
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance
  • Like a Dragon
  • The Elder Scrolls
  • The Witcher

10 Death Stranding 2: On the Beach

Hideo Kojima's Bizarre Open-World Adventure

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
Released
June 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
Powered by

Similar to its predecessor, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is an acquired taste that not everybody will enjoy; however, if you fall in love with Hideo Kojima's series, you will not find anything else that can scratch the same itch. While the first entry is a more distinct experience, Death Stranding 2 delivers a better mix of exploration, action, and stealth, although its higher accessibility could be seen as a negative. Beyond a heavier focus on combat and streamlined mechanics, Death Stranding 2 reduces some of the first game's frustration, while still retaining its atmosphere, weird charm, and focus on (relatively) slow traversal.

Regardless of whether you prefer Death Stranding or On the Beach , the series showcases the potential for open-worlds to take risks and craft a fresh journey that will be unforgettable even if you don't particularly enjoy it. The industry as a whole needs more games like these two.

9 Ghost of Yotei

An Open-World Historical Epic That Nails Nearly Everything

Ghost of Yotei
10 /10
Released
October 2, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Open-World
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
Powered by

Building on the gorgeous foundation set by its predecessor, Ghost of Yotei wisely opted against reinventing the wheel, instead just fine-tuning everything that came before. With more weapon options, superior optional content, and a more dynamic map, Sucker Punch managed to surpass one of the most complete action-adventure games ever while, arguably, perfecting the traditional open-world structure.

Telling a classic revenge story that could have easily featured in an old-school samurai movie or anime, Ghost of Yotei combines a strong main quest with stunning vistas, memorable NPCs, and brilliant combat. While the sidequests are still nothing to write home about, they add quite a bit of flavor to the setting and are fun distractions; meanwhile, the core missions are consistently fantastic.

8 Shadow of the Colossus

The Most Haunting Open-World Action-Adventure Game Ever

Shadow of the Colossus
Released
February 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Genre(s)
Adventure
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4
Powered by

Size and density matter, but only if used correctly. Shadow of the Colossus has a tiny and minimalist open-world compared to most entries in the genre, one that has no optional content at all. As Wander, you travel through a desolate land searching for 16 colossi, all of which must be killed to save a girl. Each battle is epic in scale and harrowing in execution, as these majestic creatures are (mostly) beyond simple human classifications of good or evil. They roam in peace, and you are the threat.

Shadow of the Colossus tells its story and explores its themes through its environments, music, player actions, and the somber traversal between fights. Even though the map is quite small, the world seems enormous due to the solitude conveyed by the game.

I highlighted the 2018 version just because it is the one most players are likely to play nowadays. That said, both the original and remake qualify for this article.

7 Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag

The Best Assassin's Creed Game Is The Least Assassin's Creed Game

Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag
9 /10
Released
October 29, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Genre(s)
Action, Open-World, Adventure
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Xbox 360
Powered by

Full disclosure: I have enjoyed most of the Assassin's Creed games that I have played. They are not perfect, but Ubisoft's entries have immersive historical settings, a respectable sense of scale, and occasionally good stories. Coming out at a time when franchise fatigue was beginning to set in, Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag wisely carved out a unique identity through its naval open-world, systemic play over checklists, and a more player-driven loop. While still having some hallmarks of the franchise, Black Flag is an island on its own, one that could have easily succeeded and existed without the Assassin's Creed brand.

Not only is Black Flag the best Assassin's Creed title, but it is also arguably the greatest pirate game of all time. Its Caribbean map rewards organic exploration and curiosity, more so than any of the other entries in the franchise. You don't have to stick to a rigid path and can just head out into the unknown, and it is a blast to engage in both land and sea battles. Also, Edward Kenway is one of the better protagonists in the open-world genre in general.

6 Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

The Ultimate Stealth Sandbox Game

Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain
9 /10
Released
September 1, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Genre(s)
Action, Open-World
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain is not the MGS game that most die-hard fans wanted or expected, as it minimizes some of the franchise's biggest selling points. Except for a few flashes, the story takes a backseat and is underbaked. The open-world is vast but lacks variety and is mostly devoid of life, and players spend a lot of time just traveling to their next mission, with exploration being a non-factor.

For all its flaws, The Phantom Pain absolutely nails its gameplay and progression, delivering what is still arguably the greatest sandbox combat loop ever. The game not only lets, but actively demands that players plan out their approach for each mission. You decide whether to take your time and scout enemies before killing them from the shadows or to scream "to hell with it" and just go in guns blazing. What it lacks in other areas, The Phantom Pain makes up for with its best-in-class mechanical excellence.

5 Beyond Good & Evil

An Impressive Early Attempt At An Open-World Game Wrapped Up In A Perfect Adventure

Beyond Good And Evil
Released
November 11, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Milan, Ubisoft Montpellier
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
PS3, PS2, Xbox 360, Xbox (Original), Nintendo GameCube, PC
Powered by

Once upon a time, open-worlds were not synonymous with quantity but rather non-linear quality. Way ahead of its time, Beyond Good & Evil makes full use of the Hillys, with nearly every area serving story moments and introducing new gameplay mechanics or adding wrinkles to existing ones.

While not the first open-world action-adventure game, Ubisoft's title foreshadowed the genre's future, as it blended exploration, stealth, combat, and puzzles in a way that would not become a staple until years later. More importantly, Beyond Good & Evil is still very much a 2003 release that mostly wants to get through its main story without too many distractions, resulting in a campaign that is paced almost perfectly. Beyond Good & Evil was so fantastic that Ubisoft has seemingly not been able to put together a sequel that could live up to its legacy.

4 Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

The Best Game In The Biggest Open-World Franchise

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3, Xbox (Original), Xbox 360, PC, macOS, iOS, Android
Powered by

Personal preference dictates which GTA should be included, but I think everyone agrees that Rockstar's series has to be mentioned in this discussion. Grand Theft Auto 5 has been inescapable for more than a decade and, without question, is the franchise's biggest release, while GTA 3 might be the most important open-world game ever. That said, San Andreas is not only the best GTA game, but it has also aged more gracefully than the other classic entries.

In 2004, San Andreas was absurdly impressive with its three cities, rural areas, story scope, character writing, and minor customization options. GTA 3 wrote the blueprint for modern open-worlds, but San Andreas stamped and codified it, crafting a legacy that has endured through generations of technological and mechanical advancements. The game was a defining cultural phenomenon that defined the entire gaming industry rather than just a single genre.

3 Batman: Arkham City

The Best Combat In The Open-World Action-Adventure Genre

Batman: Arkham City
9 /10
Released
October 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rocksteady Studios
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
PS3, PC, Xbox One, PS4, Xbox 360, Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch
Powered by

Rocksteady's Arkham Asylum revitalized the superhero genre, casting a shadow that would spawn the likes of Mad Max and Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor . After crafting perfection, the developer somehow managed to repeat the feat with Batman: Arkham City , expanding the famous prison's walls to cover city streets, rooftops, and side-quests. Arkham City, the map, is dense with quality and mostly devoid of filler content except for the infamous Riddler missions.

Subscribe for expert takes on open-world action-adventure

Hungry for more on open-world action-adventure games? Subscribe to the newsletter for curated coverage, in-depth analysis, and clear recommendations on these titles, plus broader gaming perspectives that expand the conversation.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Fusing story and setting, Batman's journey organically takes him around the city and into zones held by his famous rogues' gallery, and players can completely immerse themselves in the main storyline if they want a relatively linear experience. Similar to modern games like Marvel's Spider-Man , Batman: Arkham City gets its traversal spot on, allowing you to glide, grapple, and move like the Caped Crusader. That extends to the free-flow combat, which is the best of any action-adventure open-world game mentioned in this article.

As much as I love Arkham Knight , the Batmobile sections slightly overstay their welcome.

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

The Best Story In An Open-World Action-Adventure Game

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
Powered by

Except for maybe Kingdom Come: Deliverance , Red Dead Redemption 2 has the most immersive open-world of all time, and I am not talking solely about graphics. From NPCs to the weather and wildlife, everything feels alive and reactive, dropping players squarely in the Wild West during one of the most volatile and dangerous eras in human history. Exploration is rewarded through random, unpredictable events that tell quick stories. Even if it was taken a bit too far in certain areas, Rockstar's devotion to realism crafted a one-of-a-kind experience that is unlikely to be replicated or matched.

RDR2 casts you as Arthur Morgan, an outlaw who is slowly seeing his place in the world vanish as America gradually phases out outcasts like him. We get to see and shape his relationship with the Van der Linde gang, all the while deciding whether he has honor or is just a violent killer. The story is RDR2 's best element, and its themes are reflected by the world as a whole.

1 The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild

The Ultimate Action-Adventure Franchise And The Genre-Changing Open-World Game

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Powered by

The Legend of Zelda is responsible for a couple of the greatest action-adventure games ever, a few of which were even pseudo-open-world. While Ocarina of Time , Wind Waker , and Majora’s Mask set the foundation, Breath of the Wild built a tower that reached a new peak for open-worlds, at least in terms of exploration. Bringing Hyrule to life like never before, BOTW wastes little time freeing players, almost immediately telling them to go out and explore to their heart’s content. You only have one truly mandatory story beat, but everything else is, technically, optional and by the player's choice.

Although relatively empty, the world is stunning, atmospheric, and filled with small touches that bring personality to encounters. BOTW is about as pure an action-adventure game as they come, although it leans a bit more into the “adventure” side of things, with its heavy focus on puzzles, discovery, and creativity. While the story is nothing special and mostly secondary, the journey is unforgettable and stunning from beginning to end, and it really feels like your adventure. Tears of the Kingdom is arguably better in most areas, but it is not quite as special as Breath of the Wild .

Honorable Mentions

  • Donkey Kong Bananza
  • Far Cry 3
  • Horizon Zero Dawn
  • Just Cause 3
  • Mafia 2
  • Marvel's Spider-Man
  • Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor
  • No Man's Sky
  • Outer Wilds (More adventure than action-adventure)
  • Saints Row 2
  • Sleeping Dogs
  • Watch Dogs 2
  • Yakuza (Toes the line between action-adventure and RPG)

item.title: Matt Mercer Comments on the Future of Critical Role
item.description:
Critical Role dungeon master Matt Mercer shared his thoughts on the future of the beloved Dungeons and Dragons web series, considering when his time with the series will end. The iconic tabletop RPG has grown more popular throughout the past decade, with new revisions to the game and the rise of online live-plays. Dungeons and Dragons series like Critical Role , Dimension 20 , and Acquisitions Incorporated have helped to bring the game to a massive new audience, attracting new players and bringing in even more eyes. However, Critical Role has easily been among the most notable in the trend.

Critical Role has arguably been the most culturally significant live-play series to come from the Dungeons and Dragons IP. The series, originally DMed by popular actor Matt Mercer, has featured some of the biggest voice talents in the industry, including beloved names like Travis Willingham, Liam O'Brien, and Laura Bailey. The most recent season of Critical Role even saw a new player step into the Dungeon Master position, with Brennan Lee Mulligan leading the fourth campaign. Now, Matt Mercer has officially shared his thoughts on stepping away from the role of DM for Critical Role .

Matt Mercer Wants to "Show Off Others' Passions" with Critical Role

A recent interview with Variety saw Matt Mercer share his thoughts on where Critical Role could go in the future. Mercer addressed his decision to take a step back from DMing Critical Role for the fourth season, sharing his gratitude for "already exceeding his expectations" for what he could accomplish. Mercer cited his desire to use Critical Role as a platform to "show off other people's passions," including Mulligan taking over running the show for Critical Role 's fourth campaign and potentially stepping back from Critical Role as a whole. Matt Mercer has previously spoken about his sentiments of "passing the torch" of Critical Role , allowing other members of the party to take the spotlight.

Matt Mercer potentially stepping away from Critical Role comes as the actor has become one of the biggest public faces of Dungeons and Dragons . The popularity of Critical Role has seen Mercer work with Wizards of the Coast multiple times to develop official content based on the series, including Call of the Netherdeep and The Explorer's Guide to Wildemount. Matt Mercer's distinctive style of DMing has even led to what fans refer to as the "Mercer effect," causing newer DMs to be overambitious with their own games after watching Critical Role .

Critical Role Has Become a Dungeons and Dragons Icon

While Matt Mercer may be considering stepping away from the series he helped to create, Critical Role has grown far beyond its D&D roots. Critical Role Productions officially launched its own tabletop RPG in early 2025, with Daggerheart utilizing a unique system inspired by the storytelling-focused approach used within the series. The introduction of Brennan Lee Mulligan as dungeon master has also brought a fresh perspective to the series, including the switch to a West Marches style of gameplay with larger, split parties of players. Mulligan also has plenty of previous experience as a dungeon master, acting as the main DM for Dimension 20 .

Critical Role 's future could be in good hands with Brennan Lee Mulligan as Dungeons and Dragons continues to evolve around the series. 2024 saw the launch of the newest major revision to Dungeons and Dragons , launching with a brand-new Player's Handbook, Dungeon Master's Guide, and Monster Manual. Wizards of the Coast has also already added a new class to Dungeons and Dragons ' 2024 revision, with the release of Eberron: Force of the Artificer introducing an official version of the titular class. The continued growth of Dungeons and Dragons will surely see series like Critical Role innovate and change with fresh new ideas and perspectives.

item.title: Fox That Provided Sounds for Kiriko's Kitsune Spirit in Overwatch 2 Has Died
item.description:
Finnegan Fox, conservationist icon and animal voice actor in Overwatch 2 , has passed away, as confirmed by the YouTube channel of the SaveAFox Rescue charity he represented for several years. SaveAFox representatives and fans around the world are mourning the loss of Finnegan, whose vocal appearance in Overwatch 2 was just a small part of his legacy.

Nearly a full year before its release, Overwatch 2 announced a new support character named Kiriko, a fox-eared ninja known for tossing around protection suzu to heal her allies and kunai to harm her enemies. Her skills and stylish appearance quickly won her a lot of praise, as did her kitsune spirit, an ethereal fox voiced by the late Finnegan, which was the icing on the cake for a lot of players.

Finnegan Fox of Overwatch 2 Fame Has Died

Now, SaveAFox has confirmed that Finnegan passed away roughly two months ago. After being rescued in 2015, he immediately bonded with his new keeper, Mikayla Raines, who four years later went on to found SaveAFox, a charitable organization dedicated to saving foxes from fur farms. The charity has raised a lot of awareness for animal conservation by gaining popularity on platforms like YouTube and TikTok, and while multiple different foxes have been featured in their videos, the humorous disagreements between Raines and the whiny, mischievous, and sometimes spoiled Finnegan, have helped SaveAFox's channels on those two platforms alone rack up a combined 5.6 million followers in less than seven years. "He's honestly largely responsible for us being able to save as many animals as we did," said Ethan Frankamp, the current head of SaveAFox, in a 41-minute-long tribute to Finnegan on the charity's YouTube channel.

The famous video game pet was preceded in death by his handler and human best friend, Raines, who passed away at the age of 30 in June 2025. The news of the world's most famous fox's passing was broken by Raines’ widower, Frankamp, across several social media platforms. Frankamp apologized for delaying the news of Finnegan's death by nearly two months, explaining that he has been experiencing a lot of personal difficulty, dealing with the loss of both his young wife and his favorite animal in such a short amount of time. In a post on Facebook, he offered to reimburse any sponsors who made monetary donations directed at Finnegan over the past two months, but he also made a request for help in reimbursing the charity for Finnegan's end-of-life medical expenses, which has racked up more than $6,100 of donations in less than 21 hours.

Fans aware of Finnegan Fox's involvement in Overwatch 2 and those who came to know him through his videos have been paying tribute to him in a number of different ways online. Multiple fan accounts of the game on social media have shared side-by-side images of the kitsune spirit and the handsome fox who provided his unforgettable voice, along with images and videos showcasing some of his most humorous or adorable antics caught on film across the years. These include multiple instances of him snuggling and playing with Raines, as well as sharing a tasty fish with a small fox pup, and, of course, making a wide variety of happy, whiny sounds.

Those who would like to make a contribution to SaveAFox in memory of Finnegan can do so through the charitable organization's official website. Additionally, Infuse Studio's cozy action-adventure animal game series Spirit of the North , in which players assume the role of an Icelandic red fox, has a partnership with SaveAFox that brought three of its most popular foxes, including Finnegan, into the game as skins. 100 percent of the purchase price of these skins are being donated directly to SaveAFox.

6 /10

Overwatch 2

item.title: All Silksong Craftmetal Locations (& Where to Use Them)
item.description:
Players will start acquiring Craftmetal fairly early on in the game, and these are valuable resources required to purchase or craft certain Tools throughout Hollow Knight: Silksong . There are a total of eight Craftmetals scattered across the massive map, some of which are hidden behind secret paths and caves, which might require having a certain ability. Here are the locations of all the Craftmetals, as well as where players can use them in Hollow Knight: Silksong .

Updated January 31, 2026, by Waseem Muhammad : Finding all the Craftmetals in Hollow Knight: Silksong is necessary for players who intend to acquire all the tools and are aiming for the Arsenal trophy/achievement. Almost all of these Craftmetals are not located on the main path, so finding them is going to take a bit more parkouring. The guide below has been updated to remove the table and add more information about their locations, making it much easier to locate these.

All Silksong Craftmetal Locations

Only two of the below-mentioned Craftmetals have to be purchased using Rosaries, so you will not have to farm Rosaries. However, the same cannot be said when using these Craftmetals.

Bone Bottom

After starting the game and making your way to Bone Bottom , you will find your first NPC merchant. Pebb sells this Craftmetal for 60 Rosaries. If you are having a hard time gathering Rosary at the start, make your way to the northwest of The Marrow to find a bench.

Rest at this bench, and head left. There are a bunch of enemies here that you can defeat, then go on to the next room to find more enemies. Once all of them are dealt with, head back to the bench to reset them and do the farm again.

The Marrow

From the bench right of the Bellway Station , head right until you reach the second room, where you can spot a glowing explosive rock on the bottom left side. Hit this and get back so that you do not take damage. This opens up a secret path. Follow this path, and you will come across the Craftmetal.

Deep Docks

From the Forge Daughter NPC , head down and to the right to find a heavy door that requires a Simple Key to open. Explore the area up ahead until you reach a room with a locked gate with a ring hanging next to it.

Opening this requires the Clawline ability, but you do not need to access this. Simply turn around, and to the left side of the room is a blockade that you can break and go inside the small room with the Craftmetal.

Blasted Steps

Head right from the Bellway Station, and you will have to make your way through a platforming section and avoid the worms below. Near the end of this section, where you have to stick to a wall on the right and go up, you must go down instead.

Here, you will find a room with more worms and a small platform, but this ultimately leads to the Craftmetal in the far left corner.

Underworks

This is located at the end of the room, directly below where you obtain the Clawline ability. Even though you can go for the Craftmetal before the ability, grabbing the ability first makes this section a bit easier.

Wisp Thicket

Head left from Halfway Home in Greymoor , go up the tower, and head through the passage on the right, which leads to the second tower. Go up the second tower, head up, and take the left passage to exit this tower and to the top left of this area is a spot where you can double jump to access Wisp Thicket . From the Bench in the area, head left, and when you reach the small tower-like section with the flame brazier, head up and take the path on the right to find this Craftmetal.

GR Report: Subscribe and never miss what matters

Level up your gaming knowledge with Game Rant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

You can head further left to reach a small passage that leads to the Underworks. From the path below the Craftmetal, just before going up the tower, you can go further left to fight the Father of the Flame boss . This boss is quite a unique boss and one where you will be relying on your pogoing ability rather than dealing damage through hits to the boss.

Songclave

You can purchase this from Jubilana for 180 Rosaries . Jubilana will not originally sell this along with her other items, so you will have to progress through the story and complete The Lost Merchant Wish whenever it pops up on the quest board.

Putrified Ducts

For the last Craftmetal, first make your way to the Putrified Ducts . Head to the extreme right corner of this location, past Fleatopia. It is important to note that you will need the Faydown Cloak to jump up and grab this Craftmetal.

Where to Use the Craftmetals in Silksong

Tool

Map Image

Area Name

Location

Sting Shard

Deep Docks

You can purchase this for 140 Rosaries and 1 Craftmetal from the Forge Daughter who is at the Bellway Station and going down the lift.

Magma Bell

Deep Docks

This is purchasable from Forge Daughter for 110 Rosaries and 1 Craftmetal.

Pimpillo

Greymoor

This Tool is to the far left of the western tower, accessible by using the wall jump ability. You have to go left from the Halfway Home bench, climb the second tower, and take the upper left exit.

Cogwork Wheel

Underworks

In the room above, where you get the Clawline ability. From the bench, jump up and use your clawline to go inside the Twelfth Architect's shop . Talk to her and purchase the tool for 360 Rosaries and 1 Craftmetal.

Sawtooth Circlet

Underworks

This is purchasable from the Twelfth Architect for 230 Rosaries and 1 Craftmetal.

Scuttlebrace

Underworks

You can purchase from the Twelfth Architect for 140 Rosaries and 1 Craftmetal.

Cogfly

High Halls

From the bench inside High Halls, you have to go up quite a bit and go through the third passage on your left to find a small room . You can find an interact option at the top where you can craft the Cogfly using Craftmetal.

Silkshot

Deep Docks

Underworks

Mount Fay

For the final Craftmetal, you can rebuild the Ruined Tool into a version of the Silkshot. This can be done at the Forge Daughter in Deep Docks, the Twelfth Architect in Underworks, or inside a secret cave on Mount Fay.

Hollow Knight: Silksong
